items.q: Which country has the longest natural coastline in the world?
items.explanation: Canada's intensely rugged and intricate geography gives it over 151,000 miles of coastline, vastly exceeding any other nation.

items.q: The city of Istanbul uniquely sits on the landmasses of both Europe and Asia.
items.explanation: The Bosphorus strait divides the city geographically between the two continents.

items.q: New Zealand is comprised primarily of three main islands.
items.explanation: New Zealand's landmass is primarily comprised of two main islands: the North Island and the South Island.

items.q: What massive man-made structure in China was built primarily to protect its northern borders?
items.explanation: Its construction began as early as the 7th century BC and continued extensively during the Ming Dynasty.

items.q: Name the deepest known point in the Earth's oceans.
items.explanation: It reaches a maximum known depth of nearly 36,000 feet in the western Pacific.

items.q: What is the difference between latitude and longitude?
items.a: Latitude lines run horizontally east-west and measure north-south position. Longitude lines run vertically north-south and measure east-west position.
items.explanation: Together, they form a grid that maps coordinates globally.

items.q: Which large South American country is long and extremely narrow, dominating the continent's western edge?
items.explanation: It lies wedged strictly between the Andes mountains to the east and the Pacific Ocean to the west.

items.a: A tributary is a smaller freshwater stream or river that flows into a larger main river, ocean, or lake.
items.explanation: Tributaries do not flow directly into an ocean or sea themselves.

items.q: In which US state would you find the active volcano Mount Kilauea?
items.explanation: It is one of the most active volcanoes in the world globally, constantly reshaping the Big Island.

items.q: What is the capital city of Germany?
items.explanation: It physically reunited as the capital following the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989.
